newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: ECOFIN will not start with stability pact.
newsitem.headline: ECOFIN will not start with stability pact.

text.p: European Union finance ministers will turn to the issue of the post EMU-stability pact as the second item of their business on Thursday, an EU diplomat said.
He said the ministers, in a special session ahead of a two-day EU summit, would meet at 1600 GMT to discuss a lending mandate for the European Investment Bank.

This would take about an hour. The ministers would then try to solve their differences over the stability pact. Germany is insisting on fines and clear definitions of exceptions for running excessive deficits.
One source said there was a 70-30 chance that an agreement could be reached.

But the meeting was not expected to stretch too long into the evening. If no agreement can be reached, Irish Finance Minister Ruairi Quinn is likely to punt the issue over to the EU leaders on Friday, the source said.
